author: @UnioneSarda
title: Microcitemico, sindacati sul piede di guerra: «I lavoratori non sono dei pacchi da spostare»  - L'Unione Sarda.it
text:
«Non è accettabile che il personale sanitario venga spostato da una struttura all’altra, senza alcuna tutela né possibilità di scelta. Questi lavoratori meritano rispetto e certezze sul proprio futuro». Dura presa di posizione di Cgil, Cisl e Uil sulla situazione di incertezza dei lavoratori dell’ospedale Microcitemico.
«A seguito delle recenti disposizioni sul riassetto organizzativo del sistema sanitario regionale – denunciano -, il personale dell’ospedale dovrebbe essere trasferito senza alcuna considerazione per le esigenze lavorative e personali, trattato come semplici numeri anziché come professionisti essenziali per la sanità pubblica». Nel mirino dei sindacati la «mancanza di un confronto con le parti sociali e l’assenza di un piano che tenga conto delle necessità dei lavoratori». In particolare si chiede «l’introduzione del diritto di opzione, affinché il personale coinvolto possa decidere in maniera consapevole e volontaria il proprio percorso lavorativo». Questo principio – proseguono Cgil, Cisl e Uil – «è fondamentale per garantire dignità e stabilità a chi ogni giorno si impegna per la salute dei cittadini. La politica tenga conto della volontà dei lavoratori e adotti misure che rispettino le loro scelte e la loro professionalità». Da qui la richiesta di «un incontro immediato con le istituzioni competenti per affrontare la questione e trovare soluzioni condivise, ribadendo che, in assenza di risposte concrete, verranno messe in campo tutte le iniziative necessarie».
RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

author: Canadian Press
title: Another death reported since 2021 recall of home bed assist handles: Health Canada
text: OTTAWA — Health Canada is reminding Canadians about a recall of home bed assist handles after learning of an additional death. Four models of bed handles distributed by Drive Medical were first recalled two years ago after two reported deaths — one in Canada and one in the U.S. Health Canada says as of Dec. 19, the company has received a report of a second death in this country. The metal handles are affixed alongside the mattress to help people get in and out of their regular bed at home. The products are not designed for hospital beds. Health Canada says more than 68,000 of the affected handles were sold between 2016 and 2021 in Canada. It says consumers should stop using them and contact Drive Medical Canada to get a refund. The recalled home bed assist model numbers are 15064, 15062, RTL15073 and RTL15063-ADJ. No information has been provided about what caused any of the deaths, but the recall notice says that retention straps were not properly secured in the initial cases in Canada and the U.S. Drive Medical has also learned of an additional three deaths in the U.S. that happened before Dec. 6, 2021, when the recall was first issued. More than 496,000 of the bed assist products were distributed in the U.S. between 2007 and 2021. The products were sold on Amazon. This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 28, 2023. Canadian Press health coverage receives support through a partnership with the Canadian Medical Association. CP is solely responsible for this content. The Canadian Press

author: Kristina Houck
title: 5 San Diego Students Win Sustainability Scholarships From Wheelhouse | San Diego, CA Patch
text: [Schools](/california/san-diego/schools) 5 San Diego County Students Win Sustainability Scholarships From Wheelhouse Credit Union Wheelhouse Credit Union's Sustainability College Scholarship Program supports the next generation of environmental stewards. SAN DIEGO, CA — Five students in San Diego County were awarded scholarships in recognition of their leadership, public service and desire to make a sustainable difference in their schools and communities. In an effort to support the next generation of environmental stewards, Wheelhouse Credit Union gave $1,000 scholarships to five college-bound students through its Sustainability College Scholarship Program. These are the 2024 Wheelhouse Sustainability Scholarship recipients: Find out what's happening in San Diegowith free, real-time updates from Patch. - Brooke Amos - School: Santana High School - City: Santee - College Attending: San Diego State University - Piper Brenthall - School: Scripps Ranch High School - City: San Diego - College Attending: Scripps College - Bea Colobong - School: Hilltop High School - City: Chula Vista - College Attending: University of California, San Diego - Reed Ganzer - School: Poway High School - City: Poway - College Attending: University of Massachusetts Amherst - Rylan William - School: Eastlake High School - City: Chula Vista - College Attending: San Diego State University "Our sustainability mission extends to supporting our next generation of environmental champions who share our passion to protect our natural resources and help our beautiful city thrive," Wheelhouse CEO and president Lisa Paul-Hill said. "We are honored to support these local trailblazers who are leading the way in their mission to promote sustainability in their communities. We congratulate each of these scholarship recipients and look forward to seeing the results of their great work in the years ahead." Wheelhouse's Sustainability College Scholarship Program was created in 2005 to recognize conscientious high school leaders in San Diego County who share the credit union's passion to positively impact the community through eco-friendly initiatives to help sustain the environment and resources for generations to come. Since the creation of the program, Wheelhouse has awarded $126,000 in scholarships, according to the credit union. Find out what's happening in San Diegowith free, real-time updates from Patch. Get more local news delivered straight to your inbox. [Sign up for free Patch newsletters and alerts.](/california/san-diego/subscribe)

author: lameth
title: #13 Las Naciones Unidas, sorprendidas invocando al Anticristo en el Día Mundial de la Invocación (Eng)
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#3](c3#c-3) Los satanistas son humanistas, son los otros los que encuentran justificaciones en sus dioses para cometer genocidios.
[#7](c7#c-7) Una cosa es la realidad y otra la interpretacion de los creyentes que persiguen brujas y que usan esa dialectica para encubrir genocidios.
[#3](c3#c-3) Sí. La filosofía satánica es contraria al genocidio, y además tienen una frase concreta que dice muy claramente que no es correcto violar niños, y mucho menos matarlos. Cosa que otras religiones omiten por razones obvias de que les gusta matar y violar niños.
Los de los genocidios justificados son los otros, los cristianeros y los judieros.
[#10](c10#c-10) La razon cuando hablan para fanaticos creyentes no llega. Es un negocio bien montado en las debelidades humanas. Cualquier cosa que apele a la razon es apelar a las virtudes y eso requiere esfuerzo y no siempre funciona , las debilidades los odios , fallan muichisimas menos veces y la codicia aun menos.
[#9](c9#c-9) desde pequeño soñaba con todo lo que veía en revistas de divulgación o leía en libros, pero hostia, el auge de todos estos capillitas, terraplanistas, conspiranoicos y demás fauna no lo vi venir. Me imagino que las organizaciones en contra de las pseudociencias o por estilo habrán tirado la toalla

author: Syndicated Content
title: Israeli tanks, missiles strike Gaza in offensive against Hamas
text:
By Nidal al-Mughrabi and Bassam Masoud
CAIRO/GAZA (Reuters) – Israeli forces attacked areas of the central and southern Gaza Strip where residents have been expecting a renewed ground offensive in areas crammed with tens of thousands of Palestinians already displaced by the Israeli-Hamas war.
With nightfall on Thursday, an Israeli airstrike on a house in the southern city of Khan Younis killed eight Palestinians, health officials said. Three Palestinians were killed and six injured in an Israeli missile strike on a house in Maghazi camp in central Gaza, the Palestine Red Crescent said.
“The task here is to dismantle Hamas – so that it no longer has military and governing capabilities,” Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant said at a press briefing on operations in Khan Younis. “We will be required to show a lot of perseverance and determination.”
A Palestinian journalist posted pictures of Israeli tanks near a mosque in a built-up area of Bureij in central Gaza.
The Islamist group Hamas released video it said showed its fighters targeting Israeli tanks and soldiers east of Bureij. Reuters was not able to verify the location or the date the video was filmed.
“That moment has come, I wished it would never happen, but it seems displacement is a must,” said Omar, 60, who said he had been forced to move with at least 35 family members. He declined to give his surname for fear of reprisals.
Yamen Hamad has been living in a school in Deir al-Balah, also in central Gaza, since fleeing from the north. He said people newly displaced from Bureij and Nusseirat were setting up tents wherever there was open ground.
In one of Israel’s latest airstrikes, 20 Palestinians were killed and 55 wounded in Rafah, a major town near the southern border with Egypt, Gaza health ministry spokesman Ashraf Al-Qidra said. Their bombed building was housing displaced civilians, according to local medics and residents.
SEARCHING THROUGH RUBBLE
Reuters video showed rescuers scrabbling frantically through rubble to uncover and pull out victims including a baby and several children and rushing them through milling crowds of dazed and weeping people to the nearby Kuwaiti Hospital.
Palestinian health authorities said earlier that 210 people were confirmed killed in Israeli strikes in the past 24 hours, raising the toll of Palestinians killed in the war so far to 21,320 – nearly 1% of Gaza’s population. Thousands more dead were feared to be buried or lost in the ruins.
Over the course of the war, the Israeli military has expressed regret for civilian deaths but it accuses Hamas of operating in densely populated areas and using civilians as human shields, a charge the group denies.
Hamas and its fighters are dug deep into the Gaza Strip’s dense cities and towns and their leaders are still at large.
Israel has reported 169 of its soldiers killed in its Gaza campaign after Hamas fighters rampaged through Israeli towns in a cross-border raid on Oct. 7, killing 1,200 people and taking about 240 hostages.
Some 110 hostages were freed during a Nov. 24-Dec. 1 humanitarian pause and more than 20 others have been declared dead.
U.S. President Joe Biden said on Thursday that Hamas killed an American hostage, Judith Weinstein, 70, on Oct. 7. Last week he said her husband Gadi Haggai, 73, was killed on the same day.
The Israeli military released findings of an investigation into the killings in error by its troops of three Israeli hostages in Gaza on Dec. 15. Soldiers mistook their cries for help as a ruse by Hamas militants to draw them into an ambush, the military said, concluding that the soldiers acted rightly to the best of their understanding.
EGYPT’S PLAN TO END CONFLICT
Egypt confirmed on Thursday that it had put forward a framework proposal to end the conflict between Israel and Hamas in the Gaza Strip that includes three stages ending with a ceasefire and said it was awaiting responses on the plan.
The proposal is an attempt “to bring viewpoints between all concerned parties closer, in an effort to stop Palestinian bloodshed and the aggression against the Gaza Strip and restore peace and stability to the region,” Diaa Rashwan, head of Egypt’s State Information Service, said in a statement.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said Israel will keep some form of security control of all Gaza indefinitely, though he insists that this would not amount to reoccupying the enclave.
(Reporting by Reporting by Nidal al-Mughrabi in Cairo, Bassam Masoud in Gaza and Emily Rose in Jerusalem; writing by Grant McCool; editing by Howard Goller)

author: Newsroom Infobae
title: Un vibrante gospel a ritmo de orquesta pone la guinda al Festival de Fez
text:
Fez (Marruecos), 1 jun (EFE).- La fusión de las voces negras del gospel con la percusión, vientos y cuerdas de la orquesta clásica pusieron este sábado la guinda al Festival de Músicas Sacras de Fez, en un resolutivo despliegue de medio centenar de músicos y vocalistas que levantaron de sus asientos al público marroquí.
El espectáculo 'Gospel Philharmonic Experience', un proyecto del director de orquesta francés Pascal Horecka, llenó de energía la plaza amurallada Bab al Makina de la ciudad milenaria marroquí con la cantante estadounidense Kim Burrell como estrella.
Concebido y dirigido por Horecka, se trata de una fusión entre los cantos de las iglesias negras estadounidenses y la música clásica occidental que vio la luz en 2018 en Lyon y comenzó entonces una gira por Francia que le llevó en 2023 al festival Jazz en Viena.
En esa ocasión, como ahora en Fez en el escenario enmarcado por la imponente muralla meridí, también actuó Burrell, una cantante y pastora de Houston que ha compartido escenario con Mariah Carey y Whitney Houston.
Al escenario de Fez subieron 20 músicos y 30 vocalistas, que interpretaron temas clásicos de la música afroamericana de iglesia como 'Let My People Go', 'Amazing Grace' o un último 'Happy Day' pedido por el propio público, que, alentado por un comunicativo Horecka, se fue calentando hasta acabar de pie en ovación.
El proyecto 'Gospel Philharmonic Experience' aspira, en la línea del espíritu de convivencia interreligiosa del festival de Fez, a llevar un mensaje de paz y esperanza, al reunir profesionales y amateurs reclutados de coros de gospel franceses, sobre todo en barrios populares.
Este vibrante concierto, con su impresionante fondo de murallas teñidas de coloridas proyecciones, puso así el broche final a la 27 edición del festival marroquí, que ha tenido a España como país invitado y con el maestro de la guitarra flamenca Vicente Amigo como su máximo representante.
En ediciones anteriores, el festival contó con la participación de destacados artistas españoles como Paco de Lucía, Jordi Savall, Montserrat Salvador, Enrique Morente, Teresa Berganza, Carmen Linares, La Makanita, José Mercé, y Diego el Cigala, entre otros.

author: Daniele Piccinelli
title: OpenAI crea un browser per rompere le uova a Google
text:
Il dominio ventennale di Alphabet Google nelle ricerche e nella pubblicità online è sotto doppia pressione: da una parte la Giustizia USA che chiede la vendita di Chrome e, sempre più, anche da OpenAI che dopo aver presentato il motore di ricerca con AI SearchGPT ora valuta, o molto probabilmente sta già creando un suo browser.
OpenAI si sta muovendo molto rapidamente su più fronti. Secondo quanto riporta The Information la startup che ha dato il via al boom intelligenza artificiale con ChatGPT ha discusso sia del browser, sia di possibili accordi per offrire funzioni di ricerca a terze parti.
Questo in contemporanea anche con trattative di licenza e pagamenti a editori e media, per ottenere contenuti in cambio di visibilità. Sul fronte media OpenAI avrebbe incontrato Conde Nast, Redfin, Eventbrite, Priceline e altri ancora. Dipendenti di queste società dichiarano di aver visionato prototipi e design per i nuovi prodotti di OpenAI.
In realtà, osservando la fulminante ascesa di OpenAI e prodotti AI associati, la scelta di creare un browser AI è uno sviluppo logico e naturale. Quello che forse più sorprende nelle ultime indiscrezioni sono le trattative tra OpenAI e Samsung.
Persino il partner storico più fidato di Google non può correre il rischio di farsi trovare impreparato: Samsung avrebbe discusso con OpenAI per funzioni AI sui propri dispositivi. Se l’operazione andasse in porto risulte.
Se l’operazione andasse in porto risulterebbe un colpo non piacevole per Gemini, l’AI di Google che soffre il problema di essere arrivata dopo e non senza problemi di gioventù. Non è dato sapere l’esito della trattativa, ma è un altro segnale che AI sta cambiando davvero tutto. Per quanto riguarda invece il browser di OpenAI sembra dovremo aspettare ancora un po’.
Per le notizie sull’intelligenza artificiale si parte da qui , invece per gli articoli che parlano di Finanza e Mercato sono disponibili nella sezione dedicata di macitynet.

author: Redacción Tendencias
title: Prendas, accesorios y colores que atraerán buena suerte en Año Nuevo
text:
En Año Nuevo, las prendas y colores tienen un simbolismo especial para atraer energías positivas. Aquí le contamos lo que debe saber para planear su ‘outfit’ perfecto.
El 31 de diciembre es una fecha especial para los colombianos y el mundo, pues marca el inicio de un nuevo año cargado de esperanza y renovación. Este día, muchas personas eligen sus mejores prendas y colores con la intención de atraer buena suerte para el 2025. Además, es común realizar renovaciones en el hogar y participar en rituales tradicionales, como usar ropa interior amarilla para la prosperidad, dar la vuelta a la cuadra con una maleta para asegurar viajes durante el año, o quemar el año viejo para despedir lo negativo.
Según la Revista Vogue, los colores recomendados para esta fecha están cargados de simbolismo:
- Rojo: Representa la pasión, el amor y la energía. Un vestido o blusa roja es ideal para atraer romance y vitalidad.
- Dorado o plateado: Vinculados a la riqueza y el éxito, un vestido brillante o accesorios dorados pueden ser perfectos para decretar abundancia.
- Blanco: Símbolo de paz y armonía, es ideal para quienes buscan un 2025 lleno de tranquilidad y gratitud.
- Morado: Conecta con la espiritualidad y la intuición, siendo una excelente opción para prepararse para nuevos comienzos.
- Verde: Asociado con la salud y la estabilidad, es perfecto para quienes desean un año lleno de esperanza y equilibrio.
- Azul: Representa seguridad y armonía; puede combinarse con estilos variados como pantalones sastre o vestidos cortos.
- Naranja: Un tono vivo que fomenta creatividad y optimismo, especialmente favorecedor para pieles morenas.
Accesorios recomendados
Los accesorios desempeñan un papel crucial al complementar el outfit que desee vestir. Algunas opciones ideales para Año Nuevo son:
- Piedras naturales y cuarzos: Estas piedras son populares por sus propiedades energéticas. El cuarzo rosa, por ejemplo, se asocia con el amor y la armonía.
- Pulseras y collares: Elegir accesorios con detalles metálicos en dorado o plateado puede reforzar los deseos de prosperidad y éxito.
- Aretes o anillos con gemas: Las gemas de colores como el verde esmeralda o el azul zafiro no solo son elegantes, sino que también representan esperanza y seguridad.
- Relojes y bolsos: Estos pueden elegirse en tonos metálicos o combinados con los colores simbólicos mencionados.
Tradiciones colombianas para atraer la prosperidad
Además de la elección de prendas y accesorios, los colombianos tienen una rica tradición de rituales y costumbres que buscan asegurar un año lleno de bendiciones:
- Ropa interior amarilla: Es un clásico infaltable para atraer dinero y prosperidad. Muchas personas incluso la usan al revés para reforzar el efecto.
- La vuelta a la cuadra con una maleta: Este ritual es ideal para quienes desean un año lleno de viajes y aventuras.
- Comer 12 uvas: Una por cada campanada a la medianoche, mientras se pide un deseo por cada una.
- Quemar el año viejo: En muchos hogares, se elabora un muñeco que representa el año que termina, cargado de lo negativo, y se quema para empezar con energía renovada.
- Lentejas en los bolsillos: Este sencillo ritual busca atraer abundancia y alimentos a la mesa durante el nuevo año.
